column1: On May 4, 2009, the Federal Reserve conducted an auction of $150 billion in 28-day credit through its Term Auction Facility. Following are the results of the auction:
column3: The awarded loans will settle on May 7, 2009, and will mature on June 4, 2009. The stop-out rate shown above will apply to all awarded loans.
column4: Institutions that submitted winning bids will be contacted by their respective Reserve Banks by 11:30 a.m. EDT on May 5, 2009. Participants have until 12:30 p.m. EDT on May 5, 2009, to inform their local Reserve Bank of any error.
